meta.description: Definitive design system blueprint for the LimeAura productivity dashboard. Contains complete component specifications with AI-optimized implementation guidance, foundational tokens, and animation systems based on the meticulously crafted reference implementation.
meta.author: Elite AI Design Partner
meta.usageContext: This file serves as the single source of truth for implementing the LimeAura design system. AI developers and engineering teams should reference this file for exact component specifications, token mappings, and animation details.

aiImplementationPhilosophy.coreDirective: Implement components exactly as specified using the provided tokens and animation systems. Do not deviate from the documented structure, states, or timing.
aiImplementationPhilosophy.componentFirst: Build components as self-contained units with clear props/interfaces. Each component should handle its own states and animations internally where possible.
aiImplementationPhilosophy.tokenAdherence: All visual properties must reference foundational tokens. Never hardcode values that exist in the token system.
aiImplementationPhilosophy.animationPerformance: All animations must be hardware-accelerated using transform and opacity properties. Use will-change sparingly and only for complex animations.
aiImplementationPhilosophy.accessibilityFirst: All interactive components must have proper ARIA attributes, focus states, and keyboard navigation support as documented in component specifications.
aiImplementationPhilosophy.responsiveApproach: Implement mobile-first responsive design using the documented breakpoints. All components must gracefully adapt to different screen sizes.
aiImplementationPhilosophy.stateManagement: Handle visual states through CSS pseudo-classes (:hover, :focus, :active, :checked) whenever possible. Use JavaScript only for complex state logic that cannot be handled by CSS.

visualDirection.tone: Friendly, optimistic, and modern. The interface should feel alive and approachable while maintaining professional clarity.
visualDirection.colorUsage: Use the vibrant lime background (#D6F25F) as the canvas. All content lives on white cards that float above this background. Accent colors are used sparingly for emphasis and interaction states.
visualDirection.typography: Maintain clean, scannable typography with clear hierarchy. Use rounded sans-serif fonts to reinforce the friendly character of the system.
visualDirection.spacing: Generous whitespace is essential. Components should breathe and never feel crowded. Maintain consistent spacing scales throughout.
visualDirection.motion: Animations should be subtle, purposeful, and fast. Use easing curves that feel natural and physics-based. Never animate for decoration alone.

hardwareAcceleration: Use transform and opacity properties for animations to leverage GPU acceleration
Avoid animating layout properties like width, height, padding, margin
Use will-change: transform, opacity for elements with complex animations
optimization: Limit animation duration to 300ms maximum for interface elements
Test animation frame rates on low-end devices using Chrome DevTools
accessibility: Respect prefers-reduced-motion media query for users who prefer reduced motion
Provide alternative visual feedback for animations (color changes, borders)
Ensure animations don't trigger vestibular disorders (avoid rapid spinning, flashing)

globalRequirements.screenReaderSupport: All interactive elements must have proper ARIA attributes and semantic HTML
globalRequirements.focusIndicators: All focusable elements must have visible focus states that are WCAG compliant
globalRequirements.animationPreferences: All animations must respect prefers-reduced-motion media query
